intro: Mesembryanthemum lene, commonly known as the rock rose, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are often brightly colored, ranging from pink to yellow, and bloom in the morning. Mesembryanthemum lene is popular in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
